commentary_central: The Fed pauses for a second consecutive month as unemployment is stable and inflation remains above target
commentary_higher: The Fed raises rates as price pressures from a hot US economy or tariff feed-through are evident
commentary_lower: The Fed delivers a cut as it becomes clear inflation is moderating while US economic momentum grows

commentary_central: Rates remain on hold as the labour market remains stable and inflation benign
The Fed cuts in June due to moderating inflation and a healthy US economy
commentary_higher: Persistently high inflation forces the Fed to keep rates higher
commentary_lower: Labour market weakness or clearly moderating inflation allows the Fed to move the policy to neutral or into accommodative territory

commentary_central: Fed continues path of easing to neutral or dips into accommodative territory
commentary_higher: Inflationary policies require interest rates to stay higher or rise
commentary_lower: Weakness in the real economy leads to faster pace of cuts or a lower estimate of neutral rates

commentary_central: The Fed gradually brings the benchmark rate back to neutral, after taking it below neutral levels in 2026
commentary_higher: The Fed is forced to remain cautious as inflation rises to well above target as a result of tariffs
commentary_lower: Political pressures or weak demand force the Fed to retain an accommodative stance

commentary_central: The Fed gradually brings the benchmark rate back to neutral, after taking it below neutral levels in 2026
commentary_higher: The Fed is forced to remain cautious as inflation rises to well above target as a result of tariffs
commentary_lower: Political pressures or weak demand force the Fed to retain an accommodative stance

commentary_central: Interest rates converge on a rate similar to the long-term trend growth of the US economy plus inflation, although the path towards these rates might be bumpy with long periods outside the range.
commentary_higher: Strong growth or a growing lack of confidence in US public finances requires a higher neutral interest rate.
commentary_lower: Weak and persistently low growth generates few outside options for savings, helping the longer-term interest rate to fall to low levels.
